intro: Endiandra macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf endiandra, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its broad, leathery leaves that can grow up to 30 cm in length. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by elliptical, woody fruits containing flat, winged seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
